block.p: WESTVACO CORP., New York, a paper and packaging company, said it bought the closely held DuBois Holdings Ltd., a European maker of plastic holders for digital video discs. Terms were not disclosed.

WESTERN WIRELESS CORP., Bellevue, Wash., a provider of phone service in rural areas, acquired a 6.78 percent stake in Hickory Tech Corp., Mankato, Minn., and said it might consider a bid to take over the company. Western Wireless paid about $13.8 million.
WESTVACO CORP., New York, a paper and packaging company, said it bought the closely held DuBois Holdings Ltd., a European maker of plastic holders for digital video discs. Terms were not disclosed.

WESTERN WIRELESS CORP., Bellevue, Wash., a provider of phone service in rural areas, acquired a 6.78 percent stake in Hickory Tech Corp., Mankato, Minn., and said it might consider a bid to take over the company. Western Wireless paid about $13.8 million.
TREESOURCE INDUSTRIES INC., Portland, Ore., owner of eight lumber mills has laid off 89 workers at their Central Point Lumber mill.

DATUM INC., Irvine, Calif., a telecommunications equipment company, said it would cut jobs and combine operations in Beverly, Mass., and San Jose, Calif., to reduce costs and eliminate duplicate positions and services. The number of job cuts was not immediately disclosed.
